##  Making a complaint

If you have a problem with the contract or the service (for example, network
coverage issues or billing disputes), contact your provider to try sort out
the issue.

If you can’t fix the problem informally, you can complain in writing to the
internet service provider.

If you are not happy with the response, you can contact ComReg for more advice
and help.

ComReg’s customer care team are available by:

  * [ Live web chat ](https://importal.comreg.ie/gui2/login.jsp?&genproject=ComReg+Live)
  * [ Online form ](https://www.comreg.ie/advice-information/consumer-care/contact-our-consumer-care-team#complaints-form-target)
  * **Email** to [ consumerline@comreg.ie ](mailto:consumerline@comreg.ie)
  * **Text** with the word COMREG to 51500 (standard SMS rates apply) to receive a call back from the customer care team 
  * **Phone** on 01 8049668 
  * **Irish sign language** through the Consumer Line at [ consumerline@comreg.ie ](mailto:consumerline@comreg.ie) or SLIS at [ bookings@slis.ie ](mailto:bookings@slis.ie) and an appointment will be arranged
